question.title: A Java Exception has occurred
question.body: I tried to run my jar by double clicking on it but I got "A Java exception occurred", I also tried to run it via command prompt (cmd) and it worked, the program ran fine. I already have the Java(tm) Development Kit 24 (64-bit) and Java 8 Update 451 (64-bit) installed.I have already java(tm) se development kit 24 (64-bit) and Java 8 Update 451(64-bit) instaled.

answers.body:
Make sure your .jar files open with the correct Java runtime (preferably javaw.exe from JDK 24):

  • Right-click your .jar file → Open with → Choose another app

  • Click "More apps" → Look for another app on this PC

  • Navigate to:

    C:\Program Files\Java\jdk-24\bin\javaw.exe

  • Select javaw.exe, and check “Always use this app…”

  • If jdk-24 doesn't exist, check where it's installed exactly.

This happens because when you run it thru cmd, you’re explicitly using the correct version of Java, but when your running it by double-clicking on it, you're use whatever javaw.exe is associated with .jar files, and that could be the wrong version (e.g., Java 8 vs Java 24).

question_comments.body: Thank's , yeah a i think that was the problem, i had installed java 8 and 24 and i think it was trying to executed with java 8
1) how did you run it via command prompt? 2) what is the command associated with .jar files? (probably the JAR is compiled with Java 24, but .jar is associated (executed) with Java 8)
Show the command line that works, as the equivalent will be required for the file type mappings / associations for ".jar" and may also need main class in manifest.
Most likely clicking it runs it with one version of java, command line runs it with the other one. Try running java -version on the command line.

79625444.body: assuming it is a Windows system... (usually ftype jarfile will show the actual association)
